abstract.t: S/MIME (Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions), described in[SMIME-MSG], provides a method to send and receive secure MIMEmessages. Before using a public key to provide security services, theS/MIME agent MUST certify that the public key is valid. S/MIME agentsMUST use PKIX certificates to validate public keys as described in theInternet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure (PKIX) Certificate and CRLProfile [KEYM]. S/MIME agents MUST meet the certificate processingrequirements documented in this document in addition to those statedin [KEYM].
